Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Serpens Heyl Ffayr Wyff and comely dame Ã¾is ffrute to Ete I Ã¾e cownselle take Ã¾is Appyl and Ete Ã¾is ssame Ã¾is frute is best as I Ã¾e telle. Eua That appyl to Ete I were to blame ffrom joy oure lorde wold us expelle we xuld dye and be put out with schame in joye of paradyse nevyr more to duelle God hym self Ã¾us sayde what day of Ã¾at frute we Ete with Ã¾ese wurdys god dyd us threte Ã¾at we xuld dye our lyff to lete Ã¾erffore I am affrayde. Serpens Of Ã¾is Appyl yf ?e wyl byte Evyn as god is so xal ?e be wys of Connyng as I ?ow plyte lyke on to god in al degre Sunne and mone and sterrys bryth ffysch and foule boÃ¾e sond and se at ?our byddyng bothe day and nyth all thynge xal be in ?owre powste ?e xal be goddys pere Take Ã¾is appyl in Ã¾in hond and to byte Ã¾er of Ã¾ou ffond take a nother to Ã¾in husbond Ã¾er of haue Ã¾ou no dwere. Eua So wys as god is in his gret mayn and ffelaw in kunnyng ffayn wold I be. Serpens Ete Ã¾is Appyl and in certeyn Ã¾at I am trewe sone xalt Ã¾ou se. Eva To myn husbond with herte fful fayn Ã¾is appyl I bere as Ã¾ou byddyst me Ã¾is frute to Ete I xal asayn so wys as god is yf we may be And goddys pere of myth To myn husbond I walke my way and of Ã¾is appyl I xal a-say to make hym to Ete yf Ã¾at I may and of Ã¾is ffrewte to byth. hic eua reueniet ade viro suo et dicet ei. My semely spowse and good husbond lysteneth to me sere I ?ow pray take Ã¾is ffayr appyl all in ?our hond Ã¾er of a mursel byte and a-say To Ete Ã¾is appyl loke Ã¾at ?e fonde Goddys ffelaw to be al-way All his wysdam to vndyrstonde and goddys pere to be ffor Ay all thyng for to make both ffysch and foule se and sond byrd and best watyr and lond Ã¾is appyl Ã¾ou take out of myn hond a bete Ã¾erof Ã¾ou take. Adam I dare not towch Ã¾in hand ffor dred of oure lord god omnypotent if I xuld werke after Ã¾i reed of god oure makere I xuld be shent If Ã¾at we do Ã¾is synful dede we xal be ded by goddys jugement out of Ã¾in hand with hasty spede cast out Ã¾at appyl a-non present ffor fer of goddys threte. Eva Of Ã¾is appyl yf Ã¾ou wylt byte goddys pere Ã¾ou xalt be pyht So wys of kunnyng I Ã¾e plyht Ã¾is frute yf Ã¾ou wylt Ete. Adam If we it Ete oure self we kylle as god us told we xuld be ded to ete Ã¾at frute and my lyf to spylle I dar not do aftyr Ã¾i reed. Eua A ffayr Aungell Ã¾us seyd me tylle to Ete Ã¾at appyl take nevyr no dred so kunnyng as god in hevyn hille Ã¾ou xalt sone be with-inne a sted Ã¾erfore Ã¾is frute Ã¾ou Ete. Adam Off goddys wysdam for to lere and in kunnyng to be his pere of thyn hand I take it here and xal sone tast Ã¾is mete. Adam dicit sic Alas Alas ffor Ã¾is fals dede my flesly frend my fo I fynde Schameful synne doth us vn-hede I se vs nakyd be-fore and be-hynde oure lordys wurd wold we not drede Ã¾erfore we be now caytyvys vn-kynde oure pore preuytes ffor to hede Summe ffygge levys fayn wolde I fynde Ffor to hyde oure schame Womman ley Ã¾is leff on Ã¾i pryvyte And with Ã¾is leff I xal hyde me Gret schame it is vs nakyd to se Oure lord god Ã¾us to grame. Eva Alas Ã¾at evyr Ã¾at speche was spokyn Ã¾at Ã¾e fals Aungel seyd on to me Alas oure makers byddyng is brokyn Ffor I haue towchyd his owyn dere tre oure fflescly eyn byn al vnlokyn nakyd for synne oure sylf we se Ã¾at sory Appyl Ã¾at we han sokyn to deth hath brouth my spouse and me Ryth grevous is oure synne of mekyl shame now do we knowe Alas Ã¾at evyr Ã¾is Appyl was growe to dredful deth now be we throwe in peyne vs evyr to pynne. Deus Adam Ã¾at with myn handys I made where art Ã¾ou now what hast Ã¾ou wrought. Adam A lord for synne oure flourys do ffade I here Ã¾i voys but I se Ã¾e nought Deus Adam why hast Ã¾ou synnyd so sone Ã¾us hastyly to breke my bone And I made Ã¾e mayster vndyr mone Trewly of Euery tre O tre I kept for my owe Lyff and deth Ã¾er-in I knowe Ã¾i synne fro lyf now Ã¾e hath throwe Ffrom deth Ã¾ou mayst not fle. Adam Lord I haue wrought a?ens Ã¾i wyll I sparyd nat my sylf to spylle Ã¾e woman Ã¾at Ã¾ou toke me tylle sche brought me Ã¾er to It was here counsell and here reed sche bad me do Ã¾e same deed I walke as werm with-outyn wede A-wey is schrowde and sho. Deus Womman Ã¾at arte Ã¾is mannys wyffe why hast Ã¾ou steryd ?our bothers stryffe now ?e be ffrom ?our ffayr lyffe and are demyd for to deye Vnwys womman sey me why Ã¾at Ã¾ou hast don Ã¾is fowle foly and I made Ã¾e a gret lady in paradys for to pleye. Eua Lord whan Ã¾ou wentyst from Ã¾is place A werm with An Aungelys face he hyth vs to be ful of grace Ã¾e frute yf Ã¾at we Ete I dyd his byddyng Alas Alas now we be bowndyn in dethis las I suppose it was sathanas to peyne he gan vs pete. Deus Thou werm with Ã¾i wylys wyk Ã¾i fals fablis Ã¾ei be ful thyk why hast Ã¾ou put dethis pryk in Adam and his wyff thow Ã¾ei bothyn my byddyng haue brokyn out of whoo ?et art not wrokyn in helle logge Ã¾ou xalt be loky And nevyr mo lacche lyff. Diabolus I xal Ã¾e sey where ffore and why I dede hem all Ã¾is velony ffor I am ful of gret envy Of wreth and wyckyd hate That man xulde leve above Ã¾e sky where as sum tyme dwellyd I and now I am cast to helle sty streyte out at hevyn gate. Deus Adam ffor Ã¾ou Ã¾at appyl boot A-?ens my byddyng well I woot Go teyl Ã¾i mete with swynk and swoot in to Ã¾i lyvys ende Goo nakyd vngry and bare ffoot Ete both erbys gres and root thy bale hath non other boot as wrecch in werlde Ã¾ou wende. womman Ã¾ou sowtyst Ã¾is synnyng And bad hym breke myn byddyng Ã¾erfore Ã¾ou xalt ben vndyrlyng to mannys byddyng bend what he byddyth Ã¾e do Ã¾ou Ã¾at thynge and bere Ã¾i chyldere with gret gronynge In daungere and in deth dredynge in to Ã¾i lyvys ende. Thou wyckyd worm ffull of pryde ffowle envye syt be Ã¾i syde Vpon Ã¾i gutt Ã¾ou xalt glyde As werm wyckyd in kende tyl a mayden in medyl-erth be born Ã¾ou ffende I warn Ã¾e be-forn thorwe here Ã¾i hed xal be to-torn On wombe a-wey Ã¾ou wende. Diabolus At Ã¾i byddyng ffowle I falle I krepe hom to my stynkyng stalle helle pyt and hevyn halle xul do Ã¾i byddyng bone I ffalle down here a ffowle freke ffor Ã¾is ffalle I gynne to qweke with a ffart my brech I breke my sorwe comyth ful sone. Deus Ffor ?our synne Ã¾at ?e haue do out of Ã¾is blysse sone xal ?e go in erthly labour to levyn in wo and sorwe Ã¾e xal a-tast Ffor ?our synne and mys-doyng An Angell with a swerd brennyng out of Ã¾is joye he xal ?ow dyng ?our welth awey is past Hic recedit deus et angelus seraphicus cum gladio fflammea verberat adam et Euam extra paradisum. Seraphim ?e wrecchis vnkend and ryht vnwyse out of Ã¾is joye hy? ?ow in hast with flammyng swerd ffrom paradyse to peyn I bete ?ow of care to tast ?our myrth is turnyd to carfull syse ?our welth with synne a-wey is wast ffor ?our ffalse dede of synful gyse Ã¾is blysse I spere ffrom ?ow ryth fast here-in come ?e no more Tyl a chylde of a mayd be born and vpon Ã¾e rode rent and torn to saue all Ã¾at ?e haue forlorn ?our welth for to restore. Eva Alas alas and wele away Ã¾at evyr towchyd I Ã¾e tre I wende as wrecch in welsom way in blake busshys my boure xal be In paradys is plente of pleye Ffayr frutys ryth gret plente Ã¾e ?atys be schet with godys keye my husbond is lost be-cause of me leve spowse now Ã¾ou fonde Now stomble we on stalk and ston my wyt a-wey is fro me gon wrythe on to my necke bon with hardnesse of Ã¾in honde. Adam Wyff Ã¾i wytt is not wurth a rosch leve woman turne Ã¾i thought I wyl not sle fflescly of my fflesch Ffor of my flesch Ã¾i fflesch was wrought Oure hap was hard oure wytt was nesch to paradys whan we were brought my wepyng xal be longe ffresch schort lykyng xal be longe bought no more telle Ã¾ou Ã¾at tale Ffor yf I xulde sle my wyff I sclow my self with-owtyn knyff in helle logge to lede my lyff with woo in wepyng dale. But lete vs walke forth in to Ã¾e londe with ryth gret labour oure fode to fynde with delvyng and dyggyng with myn hond oure blysse to bale and care to-pynde And wyff to spynne now must Ã¾ou ffonde oure nakyd bodyes in cloth to wynde tyll sum comforth of godys sonde with grace releve oure careful mynde Now come go we hens wyff. Eva Alas Ã¾at ever we wrought Ã¾is synne oure bodely sustenauns for to wynne ?e must delve and I xal spynne in care to ledyn oure lyff.
